message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) because it presents a document compression system that uses a hierarchical model of text production. It also involves the automatic derivation of syntactic and discourse structures of the input text, which are common topics in computational linguistics research. 

It could also belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category because document summarization is a common task in information retrieval, and the paper's approach could potentially be used to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of information retrieval systems. 

The paper's use of statistical models and machine learning techniques to generate document compressions suggests that it could also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) or Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. 

Finally, the paper's focus on generating coherent and grammatical document compressions could make it relevant to the Natural Language Processing (cs.NE) sub-category, which deals with the development of algorithms and models for processing and understanding natural language.
